entry.title: Mabel Freer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mabel Freer (pictured) was deported from Australia because she could not speak Italian?

entry.title: January 2023 election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the January 2023 election of the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives was the longest speaker election since December 1859 – February 1860?

entry.title: PeopleSound (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that PeopleSound was Europe's most visited music streaming site in 2000, and had offered any artist £100 for each song they uploaded?

entry.title: Segun Olubi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that American football linebacker Segun Olubi grew up in New Jersey, Minnesota, Arizona, England, and California, and attended four different colleges in Idaho, California, and Arkansas?

entry.title: Odysseus, Verbrecher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to a critic, Odysseus, Verbrecher portrays Odysseus with post-traumatic stress disorder?

entry.title: a TV station in Arkansas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that nearby homeowners believed the tower of a TV station in Arkansas was responsible for "a bad effect on the peace and health of the citizens"?

entry.title: St Mary's Anglican Church, Busselton, (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that St Mary's Anglican Church, Busselton, Australia, has been a part of six dioceses, namely Canterbury, Calcutta, Sydney, Adelaide, Perth and Bunbury?

entry.title: a carrot-based substitute for carbon fibre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Scottish scientists attempted to create a carrot-based substitute for carbon fibre?
